intro: Erigeron longifolius, commonly known as the slender blueweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and roadsides, thriving in full sun. It features slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves, with blue to purple flowers that bloom in the summer. Its botanical structure supports its role as a nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
